CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Enforcement proceedings;Article 6-1 - Reasonable time);Violation of Article 13 - Right to an effective remedy (Article 13 - Effective remedy)
JUDGES: Aleš Pejchal;André Potocki;Angelika Nußberger;Ganna Yudkivska;Mark Villiger;Paul Lemmens
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . In DATE the company ORG instituted enforcement proceedings against the applicant before ORG . The enforcement order was issued on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG came into force in respect of GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the case was reassigned to ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the enforcement order was served on the applicant . She lodged an objection .
CARDINAL . On DATE the enforcement order was annulled and the case was to be adjudicated in the framework of contentious proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE the creditor lodged another request for enforcement against the applicant . The enforcement order was issued on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG issued a decision joining the CARDINAL cases .
CARDINAL . On DATE the first - instance court held a hearing .
CARDINAL . On DATE the first - instance court rendered a judgment , upholding the creditor ’s requests . The applicant appealed .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected the appeal .
CARDINAL . On DATE the creditor lodged a request for enforcement based on the judgment of DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG issued an enforcement order .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged an objection to the order and at the same time a request for postponement of the enforcement expressing willingness to reach a settlement . The applicant ’s objection was sent to the creditor on DATE . The creditor responded on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the first - instance court held a hearing and issued a decision regarding the objection against the enforcement order . The creditor appealed .

CARDINAL . On DATE the creditor requested the proceedings to be terminated following an out - of - court settlement reached between the parties . The decision on termination of proceedings was issued on DATE .
CARDINAL . For relevant domestic law see PERSON v. GPE ( ( dec . ) no . CARDINAL , DATE ) .
